title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwiki-bridge - (02:08): [Cindy Mitchell] So can anybody help me with my issue from last night? CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:15): Cindy: I can try if you tell me what it was. xwiki-bridge - (02:36): [Cindy Mitchell] Alright. xwiki-bridge - (02:36): [Cindy Mitchell] I'm trying to include the menubar from the Colibri skin xwiki-bridge - (02:38): [Cindy Mitchell] and I get- xwiki-bridge - (02:38): [Cindy Mitchell] Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page xwiki-bridge - (02:38): [Cindy Mitchell] Wrapped Exception: Failed to evaluate content with id [] xwiki-bridge - (02:38): [Cindy Mitchell] com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page xwiki-bridge - (02:42): [Cindy Mitchell] Can anybody help me with this? CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:42): Sorry, I was away... Just a second while I read it. xwiki-bridge - (02:43): [Cindy Mitchell] kk CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:43): What command do you use to include the menu bar? CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:44): I assume you are using velocity code to try to get hold of the bar to include it, correct? CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:50): I am also doing other things, if you want to get my attention say "Caleb" in your post and I get a popup. xwiki-bridge - (02:56): [Cindy Mitchell] #template("colbiri/global.vm") or somesuch. xwiki-bridge - (03:01): [Cindy Mitchell] I think it's because I don't know how to import stuff from my base template. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:02): Were you calling this template from inside of a document? xwiki-bridge - (03:03): [Cindy Mitchell] From inside view.vm or whatever. xwiki-bridge - (03:03): [Cindy Mitchell] Have you ever seen like how blogger does it? xwiki-bridge - (03:03): [Cindy Mitchell] with their menubar above the main website? xwiki-bridge - (03:04): [Cindy Mitchell] That's kind of how I want it. xwiki-bridge - (03:06): [Cindy Mitchell] Ah,' xwiki-bridge - (03:06): [Cindy Mitchell] okay. xwiki-bridge - (03:06): [Cindy Mitchell] Caleb- yes. xwiki-bridge - (03:07): [Cindy Mitchell] I want the default "user bar" above my design. xwiki-bridge - (03:07): [Cindy Mitchell] that gives you your whatever it gives you, lol. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:07): Yes? I'm still trying to figure out exactly what you want. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:08): Depending on what it is, there is a good chance it can be done in CSS. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:08): Let me look at a blogger page. Just a second. xwiki-bridge - (03:09): [Cindy Mitchell] Okay. xwiki-bridge - (03:09): [Cindy Mitchell] Er, blogspot. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:10): Is this what the viewers of the blog see or only what the editor sees? CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:12): I see a menu bar at the top of http://googleblog.blogspot.com/ which is like the top menu bar in xwiki except that it doesn't stay on the top of the browser window when you scroll down. xwiki-bridge - (03:13): [Cindy Mitchell] Yeah, I want the "User bar" in xwiki xwiki-bridge - (03:14): [Cindy Mitchell] but I want it to be "above" my theme. xwiki-bridge - (03:14): [Cindy Mitchell] if that makes any sense. xwiki-bridge - (03:14): [Cindy Mitchell] but I want xwiki-bridge - (03:14): [Cindy Mitchell] [xwiki "user bar"] xwiki-bridge - (03:14): [Cindy Mitchell] [rest of the theme] CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:16): Are you using the version of xwiki where the bar is fixed to the top of the browser window or the version where it moves with the page but some of it is down below? xwiki-bridge - (03:16): [Cindy Mitchell] Ask Lady Serena Kitty what version we're using. xwiki-bridge - (03:16): [Cindy Mitchell] She maintains it. xwiki-bridge - (03:17): [Cindy Mitchell] but basically, I've got this theme I'm porting to xwiki- http://www.r-butler.net/~robert\_/template/Pinnacle/ CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:18): So you want the top menu bar to be below the logo and login link? xwiki-bridge - (03:20): [Cindy Mitchell] Yeah. And then everything else sits below the top menu bar. CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:21): It looks like you want to move
and everything inside of it (until the closing
) underneath
xwiki-bridge - (03:23): [Cindy Mitchell] So how would I "add" that using velocity? CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:25): Open up startpage.vm and move #template("header.vm") up by 3 lines so it is just above
xwiki-bridge - (03:27): [Cindy Mitchell] OH xwiki-bridge - (03:27): [Cindy Mitchell] menuview and header. xwiki-bridge - (03:27): [Cindy Mitchell] Okay. xwiki-bridge - (03:27): [Cindy Mitchell] I got'cha. xwiki-bridge - (03:28): [Cindy Mitchell] wait, that's all the menubar is?  just menuview.vm and header.vm from Colibri xwiki-bridge - (03:28): [Cindy Mitchell] ? CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:30): The menu bar is menuview.vm and the logo/login info is header.vm xwiki-bridge - (03:31): [Cindy Mitchell] Ah. CalebJamesDeLisl left at 03:57 ( sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 05:45 sunny\_slls left at 05:55 ("Konversation terminated!" xwiki-bridge - (08:36): [Lady Serena Kitty] I detect a shortcoming of XWiki's LDAP integration. xwiki-bridge - (09:13): \*\*\* Lady Serena Kitty has an idea xwiki-bridge - (09:31): [Cindy Mitchell] hm? xwiki-bridge - (09:31): [Lady Serena Kitty] it seems XWiki only pulls information from LDAP xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Lady Serena Kitty] seems it doesn't push anything TO the directory xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Lady Serena Kitty] which is what we need xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Cindy Mitchell] indeed. xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Cindy Mitchell] Ah. xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Cindy Mitchell] So if I'd make changes to Halberd's users xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Cindy Mitchell] they wouldn't stick as of now. xwiki-bridge - (09:32): [Lady Serena Kitty] aye, they'd only be inside XWiki xwiki-bridge - (09:33): [Cindy Mitchell] Yeah, that's not very useful. xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Cindy Mitchell] oh by the way xwiki-bridge - (09:34): \*\*\* Cindy Mitchell brings Jessica some food. xwiki-bridge - (09:34): \*\*\* Lady Serena Kitty noms xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Cindy Mitchell] :3 xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Cindy Mitchell] hey, it's what sisters are for, yes? :3 xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Lady Serena Kitty] yar xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Cindy Mitchell] \o/ xwiki-bridge - (09:35): [Cindy Mitchell] so hm xwiki-bridge - (09:35): [Lady Serena Kitty] but I have an idea xwiki-bridge - (09:35): [Cindy Mitchell] Yey! xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Lady Serena Kitty] create a new LDAP class for XWiki that syncs upward xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Cindy Mitchell] Oooh. That'd be nice. xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Cindy Mitchell] so down-sync and up-sync. xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Lady Serena Kitty] since the one in XWiki already syncs downward, just reverse the flow xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Cindy Mitchell] yeah. xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Lady Serena Kitty] well, up-sync only, since XWiki is our master app xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Cindy Mitchell] yeah. xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Cindy Mitchell] oh xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Cindy Mitchell] then we need svn tools and stuff inside the wiki software. xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Lady Serena Kitty] already thought of that  :D xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Cindy Mitchell] :D xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Cindy Mitchell] this is going to get \*very\* interesting. xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [Lady Serena Kitty] I'm going to build an SVN browser inside XWiki, while SVN actions will be handled directly by the SVN server xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [Cindy Mitchell] squee. xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Cindy Mitchell] so we'll indeed be a mini sourceforge. xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Lady Serena Kitty] run Apache+SVN on a back-end, and have nginx forward all requests: location /svn/ { proxy\_pass http://10.25.1.4; } xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Cindy Mitchell] \o/ xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Cindy Mitchell] sweet. xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Cindy Mitchell] so hm xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Cindy Mitchell] you and I need to look at how freshmeat lists project info xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Cindy Mitchell] because I like their layout style <.< xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Lady Serena Kitty] but I'm not sure if we can have it host-sensitive like XWiki is, or if we can config SVN to treat /svn/\*/ as separate projects xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Cindy Mitchell] well xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Cindy Mitchell] we'll need an svn admin utility that writes nginx config xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Lady Serena Kitty] in other words, we won't just be a forge, we'll be a forge farm xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Cindy Mitchell] yup. xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Lady Serena Kitty] why would it need to write nginx config? xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Cindy Mitchell] projects. xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Lady Serena Kitty] mew? xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Cindy Mitchell] whenever you create/delete a project xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Lady Serena Kitty] wouldn't that be handled by the svn server? xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Cindy Mitchell] how will svn know the project exists (or doesn't exist anymore)? xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [Cindy Mitchell] we could split each of the projects off as separate svn repos. xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [Lady Serena Kitty] yar xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [Cindy Mitchell] which means each will need their own separate svn config, etc. xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [Cindy Mitchell] meaning nginx will need to know about them. xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [Lady Serena Kitty] so create/delete repos based on hostname+folder xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [Cindy Mitchell] yeah xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [Lady Serena Kitty] not if nginx is just blindly passing requests along like it does for XWiki xwiki-bridge - (09:45): [Cindy Mitchell] we might need an svn farm then, to handle requests like that. xwiki-bridge - (09:45): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya xwiki-bridge - (09:45): [Lady Serena Kitty] and hopefully that can be done on one server xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [Cindy Mitchell] because one way or another, there'll need to be either another copy of nginx or something that passes requests like that over to svn for proper handling. xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Cindy Mitchell] we could repurpose our current system for a project server. xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Cindy Mitchell] (with the new hardware and all.) xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Lady Serena Kitty] WHY would there need to be another copy of nginx? xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Lady Serena Kitty] SVN is all HTTP-based, thus, it can blindly pass requests along to the SVN backend xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [Cindy Mitchell] svn isn't a stand-alone http server, ya know. xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [Lady Serena Kitty] o.O xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Cindy Mitchell] it's http-based when something like mod\_svn is used. xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Cindy Mitchell] which means you'll need to set it all up inside the webserver config. xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya, back-end apache xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Cindy Mitchell] nginx is different? xwiki-bridge - (09:50): [Lady Serena Kitty] nginx is a performance web server xwiki-bridge - (09:50): [Lady Serena Kitty] supports proxying and caching for HTTP, IMAP, POP3, and SMTP xwiki-bridge - (09:51): [Cindy Mitchell] I meant is svn config in nginx different from svn config in apache? xwiki-bridge - (09:51): [Lady Serena Kitty] and can serve static content for HTTP xwiki-bridge - (09:51): [Cindy Mitchell] sorry, I should have been more to the point. :3 xwiki-bridge - (09:52): [Cindy Mitchell] XD xwiki-bridge - (09:52): [Cindy Mitchell] 'Blahg' xwiki-bridge - (09:52): [Cindy Mitchell] Oh xwiki-bridge - (09:52): [Cindy Mitchell] okay. xwiki-bridge - (09:53): [Cindy Mitchell] then you'll run mod\_svn+apache2 for the svn stuff? xwiki-bridge - (09:53): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya xwiki-bridge - (09:53): [Cindy Mitchell] okay, then it'll need to read/write apache2 config xwiki-bridge - (09:53): [Lady Serena Kitty] unless I can find a servlet implementation of SVN xwiki-bridge - (09:55): [NielsMayer] i'm not sure that approach is neccessary. svn is a subset of dav which is well supported in xwiki xwiki-bridge - (09:55): [NielsMayer] http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.2/svn.webdav.autoversioning.html xwiki-bridge - (09:55): [Lady Serena Kitty] hmm xwiki-bridge - (09:55): [Cindy Mitchell] interesting. xwiki-bridge - (09:56): [Cindy Mitchell] so we could in theory get svn clients to work with xwiki directly? xwiki-bridge - (09:56): [Lady Serena Kitty] that'd be sweet xwiki-bridge - (09:56): [Cindy Mitchell] it would be. xwiki-bridge - (09:56): [NielsMayer] i've been playing with davfs2. now i mount xwiki as a filesystem: mount -t davfs http://xwiki/xwiki/webdav /mnt/davxwiki/ xwiki-bridge - (09:56): [Cindy Mitchell] so xwiki-bridge - (09:57): [NielsMayer] the real issue independent of svn xwiki-bridge - (09:57): [NielsMayer] is that xwiki's dav view of things exports docs as both a wiki.txt and wiki.xml xwiki-bridge - (09:57): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya, I've mounted XWiki on my machine, too xwiki-bridge - (09:57): [NielsMayer] the wiki.xml contains objects xmlencoded xwiki-bridge - (09:58): [NielsMayer] and nobody will want to work with that, we want to work with \*.js for JSX's \*.css for SSX's etc xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [Cindy Mitchell] so, is there an xwiki davfs server that works with svn clients? xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [NielsMayer] and when checked in via svn those, e.g. JSX-0, JSX-1 ...N and SSX0-N would need to be packaged up into an xml doc and then unpackaged again on xwiki's side xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [NielsMayer] which is pretty lame xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [Cindy Mitchell] hm xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [NielsMayer] really what's needed is to have the dav view "explode" documents into their constituent objects as files xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [NielsMayer] of correct tupe xwiki-bridge - (09:59): [NielsMayer] type xwiki-bridge - (10:00): [Cindy Mitchell] heh xwiki-bridge - (10:01): [NielsMayer] thus a dav or ssh view of XWiki.Admin would be XWiki/Admin/{wiki.txt,obj.ext,obj.ext...} xwiki-bridge - (10:01): [NielsMayer] rather than XWiki/Admin/{wiki.txt,wiki.xml} xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [Cindy Mitchell] so, if the dav view could do that, we could interface directly with svn clients? xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [NielsMayer] then the same dav/svn view would "do the right thing" xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [NielsMayer]  yes alongside the Kfogel suggested hack, i believe it would xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [NielsMayer] ie. "autoversioning" xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [NielsMayer] which just checks in a new rev for each save, just like xwiki xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [Cindy Mitchell] sweet. xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [Cindy Mitchell] Well, Jessica- it looks like we can ditch mod\_svn xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [NielsMayer] i sent an email to the list a while back suggesting it xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [Cindy Mitchell] (with some tweaks) xwiki-bridge - (10:03): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [NielsMayer] what exactly are you trying to do... i saw the comment about building your own sourceforge xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [Lady Serena Kitty] we're on a joint venture to build a forge-farm xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [NielsMayer] i was one of the first pair of engineers on sourcecast project at collabnet that bought sourceforge xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [Lady Serena Kitty] the difficult part is all in SVN integration xwiki-bridge - (10:04): [Cindy Mitchell] for a joint OS project. xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [NielsMayer] i generated all the use cases for svn and was part of hiring team for karl fogel xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [NielsMayer] he rescued my cat as part of his interview xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [Cindy Mitchell] heh xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [Lady Serena Kitty] aww xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [Cindy Mitchell] how cute. xwiki-bridge - (10:06): [NielsMayer] there's no way i would climb three stories for my cat xwiki-bridge - (10:06): [Cindy Mitchell] Holy.. xwiki-bridge - (10:06): [NielsMayer] but he was tired of the meowling and the fire department was taking its time xwiki-bridge - (10:06): [Cindy Mitchell] heh xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] Jessica~ xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Lady Serena Kitty] mew? xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] I woke up thismorning with this fucking huge gash on my left calf D: xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Lady Serena Kitty] O.o xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] well, morning/afternoon xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] it's like something tried to gnaw on my leg o.0 xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Lady Serena Kitty] D: xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] indeed. u.u xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Lady Serena Kitty] its late and I sleepy kitty xwiki-bridge - (10:07): [Cindy Mitchell] awww. xwiki-bridge - (10:08): \*\*\* Cindy Mitchell lets Jessica sleep in her room. :3 xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [Lady Serena Kitty] so, I'll get to work on that LDAP auth class for XWiki tomorrow morning xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [Cindy Mitchell] alrighty. xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [Cindy Mitchell] nighty night, sis :3 xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [NielsMayer] i talk about this alot http://markmail.org/message/66zwo3wq3d46a7ev xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [Cindy Mitchell] I see. xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [Lady Serena Kitty] ya, XWiki could definitely do it xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [Cindy Mitchell] Niels, you can PM me if you want, and I'll explain as best I can (in my state) what all we're planning on doing xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [Lady Serena Kitty] and I might need to pick someone's brain about some details of an LDAP class for XWiki that does upward syncing LadySerena joined #xwiki at 10:12 xwiki-bridge - (10:12): \*\*\* Cindy Mitchell throws confetti across the void to Jessica :3 CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 14:05 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 14:06 CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:13): I'm working on updating the Scripting howto to reflect the addition of Python and the Php and Ruby macros. CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:13): I was planning on mentioning the xcontext.getContext() trick for gaining access to the raw core but say it's not a good idea when it can be avoided. CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:14): Sound good? lucaa1 left at 16:42 ("Leaving." sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 17:36 CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:40): Hi sunny. sunny\_slls - (17:41): hi CalebJamesDeLisl sunny\_slls - (17:41): sorry busy with campus recruitment stuff xwiki-bridge - (17:41): [sdumitriu] Hi sunny\_slls CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:41): Not ready to try installing? sunny\_slls - (17:42): yup i am ready sunny\_slls - (17:42): can you give me a min CalebJamesDeLisl sunny\_slls - (17:42): i will be back xwiki-bridge - (17:42): [sdumitriu] Btw Caleb, I don't quite agree with your installation tips CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:43): How would you advise? xwiki-bridge - (17:43): [sdumitriu] I agree that it would be nice to be able to install using the .war, but you have to be gentle with young students xwiki-bridge - (17:44): [sdumitriu] Some of our own people don't know how to install XWiki using the war CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:44): I never tried anything but the war :) xwiki-bridge - (17:44): [sdumitriu] The zip is nice and easy CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:45): Do you think you can help? I don't know much about it. xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [sdumitriu] You can have XWiki running in 5 seconds after the zip is downloaded and unzipped xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [sdumitriu] Download, unzip, run start\_xwiki.sh xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [sdumitriu] That's all CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:45): I just hate to give advice which I never did myself. xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [sdumitriu] Yep, that's a good strategy CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:46): I guess that's easy enough, still will you be able to help if he gets in trouble? xwiki-bridge - (17:46): [sdumitriu] Sure CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:46): Great. sunny\_slls - (17:46): xwiki-bridge, as i told CalebJamesDeLisl that i would go for war since i wan't to go for user interface first and then core part xwiki-bridge - (17:47): [sdumitriu] Since sunny\_slls seems to be more interested in the light part of XWiki (clientside development), getting to know the details about the core is not essential xwiki-bridge - (17:47): [sdumitriu] If you want to go for the .war, that's good CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:48): Installing the war is more of a server administration type thing. It's good practice but I agree it can be overwhelming. xwiki-bridge - (17:48): [sdumitriu] You'll get to learn more about how Java webapps work sunny\_slls - (17:48): xwiki-bridge,so what do you suggest me to do sunny\_slls - (17:48): ?? CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:49): It's a question of what you want to learn, do you intend to run a public server? xwiki-bridge - (17:49): [sdumitriu] Call me sdumitriu, xwiki-bridge is just a bot forwarding messages from IRC to Jabber and back sunny\_slls - (17:49): ok sunny\_slls - (17:50): literally i would like to start with the user interface part CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:51): Sorry I jumped in, I think this is your question Sergiu. xwiki-bridge - (17:52): [sdumitriu] Caleb, don't worry xwiki-bridge - (17:53): [sdumitriu] sunny\_slls: You can just download the zip archive from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download xwiki-bridge - (17:53): [sdumitriu] Or even the .jar one xwiki-bridge - (17:54): [sdumitriu] The zip one is simpler xwiki-bridge - (17:54): [sdumitriu] So this file: http://forge.objectweb.org/project/download.php?group\_id=170&file\_id=14173 xwiki-bridge - (17:54): [sdumitriu] Download it to a local folder, under the current user. No need to be root to run it. xwiki-bridge - (17:55): [sdumitriu] Unzip, then execute the start\_xwiki.sh script xwiki-bridge - (17:55): [sdumitriu] It should start running on port 8080 sunny\_slls - (17:55): ok xwiki-bridge - (17:55): [sdumitriu] Make sure you don't have anything running on that port sunny\_slls - (17:55): got it xwiki-bridge - (17:55): [sdumitriu] Or, you can specify a different port on the command line xwiki-bridge - (17:55): [sdumitriu] ./start\_xwiki.sh 9090 xwiki-bridge - (17:56): [sdumitriu] Then open http://localhost:8080/ in your browser xwiki-bridge - (17:56): [Lady Serena Kitty] okay, so today I start work on my own LDAP plugin for XWiki since the bundled one doesn't do what I want LadySerena left #xwiki at 17:57 sunny\_slls - (17:58): how many people are there in this xwiki-bridge bot?
